required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Repeatability Between SS and SD-OCT for Measuring Retinal Thickness in Various Retinal Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Repeatability Between Swept-source and Spectral-domain Optical Coherence Tomography for Measuring Inner Retinal Thickness in Various Retinal Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of intradevice repeatability of thickness measurements for macular area in the eyes with normal and various retinal diseases using SS-OCT and SD-OCT

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators studied the intradevice repeatability of thickness measurements for total retina, retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) and ganglion cell-inner plexiform (GC-IPL) layers of macular area in the eyes with normal and various retinal diseases using SS-OCT and SD-OCT and compared the repeatability between two devices.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare repeatability between swept-source optical coherence tomography (SS-OCT) and spectral-domain OCT (SD-OCT) devices for the measurement of retinal thickness in various retinal diseases.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Each device was examined twice consecutively within one minutes. After one OCT device exam, another OCT exam was performed immediately. The interval between test devices did not exceed 5 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of Intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) and coefficients of variability (CV) between devices

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare repeatability according to the degree of macular thickness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Each device was examined twice consecutively within one minutes. After one OCT device exam, another OCT exam was performed immediately. The interval between test devices did not exceed 5 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the repeatability of retinal thickness according to central macular thickness in eyes with retinal diseases

arm_group.description: Healthy subjects without any ocular problems Repeat exams of OCT device (SD and SS-OCT)
Patients with various macular diseases Repeat exams of OCT device (SD and SS-OCT)

intervention.description: All 2 consecutive OCT examinations were performed by 1 experienced technician, in the order of SD-OCT and SS-OCT. The interval was 10 minutes between examinations by each OCT devices

study_pop.textblock:
normal control : 36 eyes of 36 subjects
retinal disease group: 78 eyes of 78 patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age-matched normal group was composed of subjects with age over at least 19 years,
- a best-corrected visual acuity of 20/25 or higher,
- normal fundus and intraocular pressure (IOP) < 21mm Hg.
Exclusion Criteria:
- an spherical equivalent (SE) larger than Â± 6 D,
- cataract graded as more severe than grade 3 (Lens Opacities Classification System III),
- a history of glaucoma and optic nerve diseases, or a history of vitrectomy.
